Name: Tick-Tack Martini
Ingredients: 10 ml Giffard Menthe Pastille white crème de menthe
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Martini glass .
Review: Strangely enough, tastes like a Tic-Tac mint-flavoured Vodkatini .
History: Adapted from a recipe created in 2001 by Rodolphe Sorel, London, England. Rodolphe's original recipe omits dry vermouth and comprises 50ml vodka, 12.5ml sambuca, and 12.5ml white crème de menthe. Evolution of the Martini
Nutrition: One serving of Tick-Tack Martini contains 175 calories
